summary: This is a memorandum from the Bureau of Prisons Regional Director to the Warden of MCC New York, notifying that an After Action Review team will arrive on August 14, 2019, to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memo lists the team members and requests staff cooperation and preparation of materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose apparent suicide is the subject of the After Action Review.

events.title: After Action Review Team Arrival
events.description: A team of Bureau of Prisons staff arrives at MCC New York to begin an After Action Review of the apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Apparent Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide while in custody at MCC New York.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons initiated an After Action Review to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054).
The review team was scheduled to arrive at MCC New York on August 14, 2019, two days after the memo was written.
The memo instructs the warden to ensure staff availability, prepare requested materials (including videos and electronic records), and notify the local union.
Several team members are listed by title and location, but their names are redacted in the provided text.
The document is an internal administrative memorandum outlining the logistics for a post-incident investigation.
